name: Spain
visaRequirements: Schengen Visa required for most non-EU citizens

about.description: Spain is a country in southwestern Europe known for its diverse culture, stunning architecture, and vibrant lifestyle. From the beaches of Costa del Sol to the historic streets of Barcelona and the flamenco culture of Andalusia, Spain offers a rich tapestry of experiences.
highlights: Home to the world's third-largest number of UNESCO World Heritage Sites
Famous for its siesta culture and late-night dining

attractions.name: Sagrada Familia
attractions.description: Antoni Gaudí's unfinished masterpiece, a unique basilica combining Gothic and Art Nouveau styles.

attractions.name: Alhambra
attractions.description: A stunning palace and fortress complex from the Moorish period.

attractions.name: Park Güell
attractions.description: A public park system composed of gardens and architectonic elements designed by Gaudí.

cuisine.name: Paella
cuisine.description: A traditional Valencian rice dish with seafood, meat, and vegetables.

cuisine.name: Tapas
cuisine.description: A variety of small savory dishes, typically served with drinks at bars.

cuisine.name: Churros
cuisine.description: Fried-dough pastries, often served with hot chocolate for dipping.

transportation: Well-developed metro systems in major cities
culturalNotes: Dinner is typically served late (after 9 PM)
Many shops close for siesta in the afternoon
Tipping is not mandatory but appreciated

articles.title: Barcelona Architecture Tour
articles.description: Explore the stunning works of Antoni Gaudí and other architectural marvels.

articles.title: Madrid Food Guide
articles.description: A culinary journey through Madrid's best tapas bars and restaurants.
